relatedanime.anime: Girls und Panzer: Kore ga Hontou no Anzio-sen Desu!
Girls und Panzer: Dai 63 Kai Sensha-dou Zenkoku Koukousei Taikai - Soushuuhen

similaranime.anime: Sword Art Online Alternative: Gun Gale Online

recommendations.recommendation:
A decent sports anime. Strong on tanks and strategy. But the matches are not as epic as Achiga-Hen or Chihayafuru, even though I prefer tanks over Mahjong or Karuta, after hearing all the comparisons I thought I`d be getting intense edge-of-year-seat action packed episodes, but GuP matches are a lot more mellow, which was disappointing for me.
I barely felt like I even knew the girls, not much time was spent on them, even for a sports anime. Not a whole lot of time is spent building up opponents either, or even the tank models. The characters, the fanservice, the matches, everything was tame.
A painless watch, but not very exciting for the non-tank buff. I watched because of the huge sales, and because other Sports Anime have been awesome lately. I invested my time in this anime thinking I would get the rush in later matches like in other similar shows, but GuP never turned out as good for me. You may want to manage your expectations is all I`m saying.
PANZER VOR UND RAN AN DEN FEIND... ÄÄÄÄHHH ... AN DIESEN ANIME!!!! :D
It`s Saki with tanks instead of mahjong. What more could you ask for?

Thsi is the anime that got me interested in anime. Am biased because it is my favorite over all the other anime out there. Since a lot of anime ask you to accept the premise of "their" world then this one is fairly easy. The tanks are excellant and the girls are cute. No, you don`t get to know every characters darkest secrets from the beginning of their lives but the core group are likeable and different. Pop some popcorn, sit back and relax. Is a great show!

I first though this would be simular to Upotte, i was definately wrong. If you are a WWII history buff the tanks are drawn incredibly accurate although I cant say the same for the strategys, anyway its making for a nice time killer, have fun watching
If you are in it for the fun , there is a good chance you won`t be disappointed !

Girls und Panzer was a good watch. The idea with the tanks was really enyoing. There were some things I totally! hated. For example there were so many annoying scenes. Miho and her team gets mocked in nearly every episode. The reaction to this is a "OK, lets be friends now." However, I enjoyed the show, especially the battles.
A good anime that give you some nice action and enough fan service. Although the permise is quite strange the excution was well done. Give it a try, it is worth your time. ^^

How to enjoy Girls und Panzer: Ignore logic thinking, go with the flow; just accept and enjoy your `daily` dose of WTF. This show`s strong point is it`s ridiculousness.
How NOT to enjoy Girls und Panzer: Try to be serious about any point of the anime, or trying to apply realism to how the tanks function or are being used.
There, the choice is up to you! I liked it :)

First off, this series could easily be described as: Saki (minus the gag boobs), with tanks.
That said, if you can endure the slow build up of first couple of episodes, this show is definitely an underrated dark horse that deserves much wider recognition than it has so far gotten. From episode 3 onwards, it has done a pretty good job of portraying relatively realistic and increasingly epic battles, with even the fluffy slice-of-life portions usually having some actual relevance to the plot.
This is a series that is obviously a product of makers who love and extensively researched WWII (and all the way to modern) era combat vehicles, but are also unafraid of throwing realism under the treads of a high speed drifting tank for the sake of entertainment... And then making fun of itself for it afterwards.
Must see for all World of Tanks players!
This is the real deal.MUST SEE for everyone that enjoys World of Tanks and is a tank fan. fuk dat low rating

anime.description: In this world, Senshadou — the military art of using tanks — is every bit as important to a http://anidb.net/t2597 [yamato nadeshiko] as flower arrangement and the tea ceremony. http://anidb.net/ch44859 [Nishizumi Miho] is a new transfer student wanting nothing to do with Sensha-do. However, she is summoned before the student council president who forcibly enrols her in Sensha-do, with the ultimate goal of being part of the school`s team in the National Sensha-do Tournament. To make matters worse, every single member of the team is eccentric. ~ translated and adapted from official site by Cranston Note: The last episode premiered at a special event on 23.03.2013 in a 1-12 episode marathon run.

tag.name: military
tag.description: The military, also known as the armed forces, are forces authorized and legally entitled to use deadly force so as to support the interests of the state and its citizens. The task of the military is usually defined as defence of the state and its citizens and the prosecution of war against foreign powers. The military may also have additional functions within a society, including construction, emergency services, social ceremonies, and guarding critical areas. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: collateral damage
tag.description: The usually action orientated anime does not only show large amounts of combat and weapon use, but also the incidental massive destruction of property, often due to the inability of the protagonists to aim properly. Example: Mecha duking it out in a densely populated urban area.

tag.name: bullet time
tag.description: Bullet time refers to a simulation of variable speed (i.e. slow motion, time-lapse, …) and is characterized both by its extreme transformation of time and space to show normally imperceptible and un-filmable events, such as flying bullets. Most infamous scene using this technique, Neo dodging bullets in The Matrix film.

tag.name: present
tag.description: Somewhere between past and future.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: alternative present
tag.description: Anime that fit in the alternative present category usually have technology and society that is very similar to ours, but with differences in both, history and culture, which sometimes are blatantly obvious, but sometimes harder to place; this one can at times be very subjective.

tag.name: slapstick
tag.description: Slapstick humour is generally recognized by lots of physical abuse, horseplay and practical jokes. Also often seen are impossible situations, using sounds to illustrate impossible stunts that aren`t shown on-screen and to create tension for audience anticipation.

tag.name: school clubs
tag.description: Even though school clubs in Japan are not mandatory, there is some pressure from the social grid (e.g. fellow students, teachers) to participate in some kind of after-school activity, be it in sports or arts. Colleges also have clubs. As a comedy element in anime, some students have joined too many clubs, and are thus constantly stressed out. There is also the element of social commentary, making it clear that you have to join a club, if you want to be part of the class. Since self-founded clubs need at least 3 members, the desperate search and advertising for new members can be cause for hilarity in anime.

tag.name: combat
tag.description: Combat involves a violent conflict with the goal to establish dominance over an opponent.

tag.name: volleyball
tag.description: Volleyball is a team sport in which two teams of six players are separated by a net. Each team tries to score points by grounding a ball on the other team`s court under organized rules. Use the http://anidb.net/t7147 [competitive beach volleyball] tag for competition or professional beach volleyball play. Use the http://anidb.net/t6478 [beach volleyball episode] tag when the beach volleyball game is a one-off event, such as during a beach or pool visit.

tag.name: plot continuity
tag.description: Consistency of the characteristics of persons, plot, objects, places and events seen by the viewer. A single linear focused plot is highly continuous. A truly random plot is highly discontinuous.

tag.name: stereotypes
tag.description: This show presents stereotypes, which are generalizations about a group of people. Examples would be saying that people from a certain country or with a certain hair color are stupid. If the show deals with comedy, the stereotypes are likely to be played on for laughs; if the show is a parody, the stereotypes will be exaggerated to have their flaws exposed and may be used as a form of social commentary.

tag.name: performance
tag.description: The song performance on stage or acting in a theatre is a central part of the character`s life in this anime type.

tag.name: new
tag.description: Not based on anything, the story is a new work, usually made up by the people involved in creating the anime. Generally if an original work (原作) credit is given, it will be to the studio, or director, or other members of the production team.

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: friendship
tag.description: The feeling of trust, kindness, and friendship between a group of high school students for example, is a central theme of this anime.

tag.name: school life
tag.description: Since a large part of the anime audience still takes part in school life or is visiting college, it is only natural to choose a setting the audience can identify with, be it elementary, middle, or high school. For the older viewers a college setting with more mature real-life problems is appropriate. And since clubs take up so much time in the lives of students, these are obviously also important.

tag.name: sports
tag.description: Sports anime revolves around a recreational physical activity or skill. In addition they often adhere to certain genre conventions, the emphasis on training and practice in preparation for competition, characters desire for self improvement, and pursuit of a specific goal.

tag.name: the arts
tag.description: The arts represent an outlet of human expression, usually influenced by culture, and driven by human creative impulse. Major constituents of the arts include literature – including poetry, novels and short stories, and epics; performing arts – among them music, dance, and theatre; culinary arts such as baking, chocolatiering, and winemaking; media arts like photography and film, and visual arts – including drawing, painting, and sculpting. Some art forms combine a visual element with performance (e.g. film) and the written word (e.g. comics). From prehistoric cave paintings to modern day films, art serves as a vessel for storytelling and conveying mankind`s relationship with its environment. Source: Wiki

tag.name: coming of age
tag.description: In the strict sense the Coming of age describes a young person`s transition from adolescence to adulthood. In anime the term is used in a more general sense where the protagonists have to face a challenge, make an important decision in their life, take on responsibility, or learn a lesson, and by overcoming these obstacles they reach a higher level of maturity.

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: Newtype Anime Award
tag.description: This anime has won 1 or more Newtype Anime Award(s)

tag.name: strategy
tag.description: Instead of blindly running into a battle or trap, at least one of the protagonists devises a clever strategy to significantly improve the odds of victory.

tag.name: fate
tag.description: Fate — The predestined path of all things. The outcome is inevitable and the consequences predetermined. Whether or not the protagonist ultimately decides to follow this path shall weigh heavily on their soul.

tag.name: remastered version available
tag.description: This anime has been remastered in a higher quality format than the original release. The remaster may be a simple upscale, or it could be a full enhancement project from the original frames. This is irrespective of whether specific groups have released rips of such formats to the internet.

tag.name: the chosen one!
tag.description: One of the characters in the anime is the "chosen one", the one to bring about change, the only one to "set things right" in a "good" ending, or bring about complete destruction in a "bad" ending.

tag.name: competition
tag.description: Some sort of confrontation occurs in this show. The protagonists "duke it out" via various competitions.

tag.name: ED variety
tag.description: Several ED sequences in this anime have either a different song or different animation, maybe even to the point of having a unique ED for each episode.

tag.name: talking is a free action
tag.description: Time in comics is flexible. Each panel shows a single event, which is usually accompanied by a length of dialog, which must take some time to say. This disparity is usually accepted if it isn`t taken to extremes. But often, characters will exposit when it`s most needed: at the story`s climax, when both the intricacies of the plot and the intensity of action hit their highest. While the Heroes Outrun the Fireball, Mr. Exposition might explain why the Evil Overlord`s death caused the explosion. The Action Girl can deliver impressive lectures on why the monster`s Achilles` Heel will work, while still engaging in Waif-Fu. The Superhero can quip to his heart`s content and explain his abilities while dueling one insignificant mobster, or deliver a Kirk Summation during the course of a single Finishing Move. Sometimes even apparent mere mortals can give a lecture on what is happening when it would be a much better idea to simply run like hell. Without stopping to breathe, apparently. Source: TvTrope

tag.name: wardrobe limited to school uniform
tag.description: The main characters only wear school uniforms, even though other clothes would be more appropriate. Example: Kagome in Inu Yasha, wears her uniform in Inu Yasha`s world, although she is shown to own other clothes at home.

tag.name: CGI
tag.description: Computer-generated imagery (CGI) or computer animation is the art of creating moving images via the use of computers. It is a subfield of computer graphics and animation. Increasingly it is created by means of 3D computer graphics, though 2D computer graphics are still widely used for stylistic, low bandwidth, and faster real-time rendering needs. Sometimes the target of the animation is the computer itself, but sometimes the target is another medium, such as film.

tag.name: predominantly female cast
tag.description: A show with a predominantly female cast has mostly females as main and secondary cast members while few if any male characters have major roles. This also applies when a male lead is surrounded by females of lesser individual plot relevance, such as in a harem setting.

tag.name: happy ending
tag.description: And they lived "happily ever after"... *sniff*. All issues in the anime have been resolved, the love polygons sorted out, the conflicts resolved, the guy gets the girl (or the other way around), and everyone else lives on blissfully. (Not very realistic, but then again this is anime.)

tag.name: absurdly powerful student council
tag.description: A student council is a student-managed body inside a school which engages in administrative affairs, usually usually working in a partnership with management, staff and parents, for the benefit of the whole school environment. In real life, a student council holds no actual power; however, in many anime/manga, they have an insane amount of power, which usually allows them to overrule nearly everyone else (the school board, the mayor, the prime minster, you name it). In those cases, that device is explored as a major source of slapstick comedy.

tag.name: female protagonist
tag.description: The anime has a female protagonist.

tag.name: Engrish
tag.description: Engrish is actually a mispronunciation of English, as can be the result of someone, who does not have English as their primary language of origin (such as Japanese or Chinese). Occasionally characters in the original Japanese dialogue version of an anime will speak in English... however; this often still requires the assistance of subtitles, for while the words are meant to be said in English, the sentence structure and letter pronunciation may still be strongly related to the person’s primary language.

tag.name: 3D CG animation
tag.description: Abbreviation for "three-dimensional computer generated animation" or "computer graphics" (CGI). The traditional 2D art is enhanced by 3D imagery developed through computer modeling software. Done in the right way, this union of 3D in a 2D animated world can be a very beautiful relationship. The difference lies in what lacks the traditional 2D animation all together and may give term to something produced entirely with 3D graphics (such as the 2006 remake of "Appleseed" , 2007`s "Vexille", the 2008 addition to the "Biohazard" series and the more well known "Final Fantasy: The Spirits Within" and "Advent Children").

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: tropes
tag.description: A trope is a commonly recurring literary and rhetorical devices, motifs or clichés in creative works. This use is a broader redefining of a literary trope, the use of figurative language, via word, phrase, or even an image, for artistic effect, such as using a figure of speech. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: ending
tag.description: This is a container tag to house meta-like tags relating to how endings of anime play out.

tag.name: cute girls doing cute things
tag.description:
Cute girls doing cute things with each other (CGDCT): when girls are super friendly with each other and do all sorts of http://anidb.net/t798 [cute/moe] things with each other, but there is no yuri or shoujo ai subtext -- more specifically, there is no romantic subtext.
* CGDCT applies where the main focus is on moe/cute girls and their interactions with each other. Good examples include http://anidb.net/a9722 [Non Non Biyori] (600 weight / 3.0 stars) and http://anidb.net/a9579 [Kin`iro Mosaic] (600 weight / 3.0 stars). * Generally, CGDCT is applicable only if the anime is also tagged predominantly female cast or all female cast. * CGDCT does not apply if girls doing cute things is incidental to a larger motive/theme/meta. For example, in http://anidb.net/a8168 [Nichijou] the focus is comedy, using cute girls; the tag would not apply.
CGDCT is often mistaken as low level yuri or shoujo ai. If there is also actual romantic subtext, use the http://anidb.net/t2695 [yuri (18+)] and http://anidb.net/t2782 [shoujo ai] tags as well. Please note: CGDCT and yuri/shoujo ai are not mutually exclusive; it is possible to have an anime tagged both.

tag.name: adapted into other media
tag.description: This anime is a http://anidb.net/t2797 [new original work], and it has been adapted into other media formats. In exceedingly rare instances, a specific episode of a new original work anime can also be adapted.

tag.name: adapted into manga
tag.description: This anime is a http://anidb.net/t2797 [new original work], and it has been adapted into a manga. In exceedingly rare instances, a specific episode of a new original work anime can also be adapted.

tag.name: adapted into novel
tag.description: This anime is a http://anidb.net/t2797 [new original work], and it has been adapted into a novel. In exceedingly rare instances, a specific episode of a new original work anime can also be adapted.

tag.name: adapted into video game
tag.description: This anime is a http://anidb.net/t2797 [new original work], and it has been adapted into a video game. In exceedingly rare instances, a specific episode of a new original work anime can also be adapted.

character.name: IV Gou Sensha D-gata Kai (F2-gata Shiyou)
IV Gou Sensha D-gata Kai (H-gata Shiyou)

episode.title: 隊長, がんばります!
Captain Does Her Best!
Taichou, Ganbarimasu!
episode.summary: Tank malfunctions, deserters, and trigger happy gunners. Miho will have her hands full if Oarai Academy is to survive their first match. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 試合, やります!
We`re Having a Match!
Shiai, Yarimasu!
episode.summary: The teams are set, the roles finalized, and… the first match already decided?! Saint Gloriana Women`s Academy versus Ooarai Girls Academy. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 戦車, 乗ります!
Tanks, We Ride Them!
Sensha, Norimasu!
episode.summary: With 5 tanks found, the Tankery class split into teams and stage their first mock battle. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 戦車道, 始めます!
Tankery, Here It Comes!
Senshadou, Hajimemasu!
episode.summary: Miho wanted to attend a school that didn’t offer Tankery and she thought she did. But when the student council gives her an offer she can’t refuse, her past comes to haunt her. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: プラウダ戦です!
We`re Fighting Pravda!
Pravda-sen Desu!
episode.summary: Ooarai has gotten cocky with their recent victories and the upcoming match against Pravda will bring them back to earth. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 次はアンツィオです!
Up Next Is Anzio!
Tsugi wa Anzio Desu!
episode.summary: Ooarai is doing well but the need to for additional tanks leads the group to searching the entire ship for new firepower. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 一回戦, 白熱してます!
Our First Battle Comes to a Climax!
Ikkaisen, Hakunetsu Shitemasu!
episode.summary: Using Saint Gloriana`s trick against them Ooarai has reversed the flow of the battle. Can Nishizumi lead her team to victory?

episode.title: 強豪・シャーマン軍団です!
Veterans of Their Trade: Sherman Corps!
Kyougou Sherman Gundan Desu!
episode.summary: The tournament has started and already the real battle starts before the tanks even hit the battlefield. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: スクールシップ・ウォー!
School Ship War!
School Ship War!
紹介します!
Introductions!
Shoukai Shimasu!
episode.summary: We introduce the girls of Girls und Panzer! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: あとには退けない戦いです!
The Battle We Can`t Back Down From!
Ato ni wa Hikenai Tatakai Desu!
episode.summary: Having lost a few tanks and being overwhelmed by a Maus tank. Ooarai chance of winning is looking worse each second. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 激戦です!
The Battle Gets Fierce!
Gekisen Desu!
episode.summary: Kuromorimine vs. Ooarai, sister vs. sister, can Miho tactics compete against the Nishizumi-style. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: クラスメイトです!
Classmates!
Classmate Desu!
episode.summary: The final battle is coming up and students are approaching Nishizumi in hopes of joining Tankery. The Tankery club is on the lookout for new tanks. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 絶体絶命です!
Last Ditch Effort!
Zettaizetsumei Desu!
episode.summary: The news of the school closure has hit the morale of the team hard. The offer of surrender is beginning to look more tempting as the hours creep on, but Nishizumi has other plans. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 紹介します2!
Introductions 2!
Shoukai Shimasu 2!
episode.summary: We introduce even more girls of Girls und Panzer! Source: crunchyroll

episode.summary: ドラマCDや本編で使われなかった格言集 (新作).
